==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|wonunge}}, from {{inh|de|goh|wonunga}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*wunungō}}, equivalent to {{af|de|wohnen|-ung}}. Related to {{cog|nl|woning||house}}, {{cog|en|woning||dwelling-place}}. More at {{l|en|woning}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈvoːnʊŋ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Wohnung.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Wohnungen}} # [[domicile]]; [[dwelling]]; [[lodging]]; [[abode]]; [[accommodation]] {{gloss|any place someone lives in for a span of time longer than a vacation}} # {{lb|de|especially}} [[flat]]; [[apartment]] {{gloss|such a place when it occupies only part of a building}} ====Usage notes==== * {{m|de||Wohnung}} almost invariably refers to a flat when used of some specific place, as in {{m|de||unsere neue Wohnung|t=our new flat}}. When used more generally, without a particular place in mind, this association is less pronounced and {{m|de||Wohnung}} may be used as a broad term for any abode. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|en}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Einraumwohnung}} * {{l|de|wohnungslos}} * {{l|de|wohnungssuchend}} * {{l|de|Zweitwohnung}} * {{l|de|Einzimmerwohnung}} * {{l|de|Zweiraumwohnung}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
